history.content: During the school year CS 169 is a group project class where most time is spent working with a team of 4-5 on a course project. I suspect most summer CS 169 students will spend significant time working together every day and on weekends. For the sake of your team, I think this is a bad idea. In addition, outside of lectures there are quite a few project check-ins etc that would be impossible without being on campus. Also, summer CS upper divisions are not trivial time commitments (~30+ hours a week). Best of luck with your decision! If you decide to drop the class, I would do so sooner rather than later because I know several on the waitlist who need the class to graduate :)

Hey all, I got an internship over summer but still want to take 169. Has anyone done this before/how feasible would this be? I will be in the Silicon Valley so I can come up to Berkeley for midterms, but how much can I do offsite and how often would I need to come to campus?

Edit: It's full time, 40 hours per week
history.subject: Summer CS169 + Internship
